name: Terran Consensus
description: The Terran Consensus represents humanity's unified expansion into the stars. Their approach combines advanced technology, scientific research, and military precision. The Terran strategy typically focuses on shield technology, research advancement, and tactical flexibility.
flavor: The stars await those with the vision to see beyond present limitations. —Admiral Helena Kerner, Terran Consensus Expansion Fleet

cards.name: Hyperion
cards.ability: Can perform Orbital Strike (Attack -1) against surface targets once per turn
cards.flavor: The Hyperion's guns speak for humanity. —Admiral Kerner

art.style: Retro-futuristic technical illustration like John Berkey
art.description: A massive battlecruiser with elongated hull and multiple artillery turrets. The ship features distinctive blue engine glows against the backdrop of a gas giant. The design combines sleek curves with industrial elements, showing battle scars and active weapon systems. Dramatic side lighting highlights the detailed plating and structural elements.

cards.name: Nova-class Battlecruiser
cards.ability: Can be equipped with up to 2 weapon systems
cards.special: When equipped with Quantum Warheads, gains +2 Attack against structures
cards.flavor: When diplomacy fails, the Nova speaks with absolute clarity. —Captain Torres, TCS Harbinger

art.style: Cinematic sci-fi concept art like Dylan Cole
art.description: An imposing warship with a hammerhead design and visible weapons arrays. The ship is captured mid-firing its main cannon, with blue-white energy cascading from multiple points. The background shows a distant planet partially eclipsed by its moon. The ship's hull has distinctive geometric patterns with Terran insignia visible on its flanks.

cards.name: Liberator Carrier
cards.ability: Can deploy 2 Scout Ships per turn without gate requirement
cards.flavor: A carrier doesn't just project force—it projects presence across an entire sector. —Admiral Chen

art.style: Clean technical render like Syd Mead
art.description: A wide, flat carrier vessel with multiple launch bays visible along its sides. Small fighter craft can be seen launching from its ventral hangars. The design emphasizes function over form with a utilitarian aesthetic featuring exposed docking mechanisms and communication arrays. The ship's profile has a distinctive asymmetrical silhouette against a starfield.

cards.name: Dreadnought Executor
cards.ability: Once per game, can fire main cannon to deal 8 damage to any single target
cards.flavor: There are problems diplomacy can solve, and problems the Executor can solve. Rarely do they overlap. —Fleet Commander Zhao

art.style: Epic space opera concept art like Ralph McQuarrie
art.description: A colossal dagger-shaped capital ship with a massive forward cannon. The ship dwarfs nearby vessels and is captured powering up its main weapon, with energy coursing along conduits on its hull. The vessel features angular geometry with reinforced plating and atmospheric entry capabilities evident in its design. Dramatic lighting emphasizes its intimidating scale.

cards.name: Artemis
cards.ability: +1 to all Scan attempts
cards.flavor: Knowledge is the first weapon in any engagement. —Lieutenant Vasquez, Recon Division

art.style: Sleek digital concept art like Sparth (Nicolas Bouvier)
art.description: A nimble reconnaissance vessel with swept-back wings and advanced sensor arrays. The ship has a distinctive glass cockpit bubble and stealth elements in its design. The hull features adaptive camouflage patterns partially engaging. The background shows a nebula with the ship appearing to navigate through a field of stellar debris.

cards.name: Apollo
cards.ability: Generates 1 Science point per turn when in orbit
cards.flavor: Every question answered reveals ten more worth asking. That's why we're out here. —Dr. Okonkwo, Chief Science Officer

art.style: Clean technical blueprint style like Ron Cobb
art.description: A specialized science vessel with extensive external sensor equipment and minimal weapons. The ship has a modular design with detachable research pods and extensive communication equipment. The hull is predominantly white with blue accents and scientific markings. Multiple satellite dishes and scanner arrays dot its exterior, with crew visible through panoramic observation windows.

cards.name: Valkyrie Dropship
cards.ability: Can transport up to 2 Surface Units from orbit to planetside or vice versa
cards.flavor: We deliver boots to ground, no matter the weather, no matter the opposition. —Major Rodriguez, Drop Corps

art.style: Gritty military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A sturdy, armored transport craft designed for atmospheric entry. The ship has visible thrust vectoring engines, troop deployment ramps, and reinforced hull plating. The design emphasizes functionality with visible landing gear, attachment points, and defensive weaponry. The craft is shown descending through clouds toward a rocky, mountainous terrain.

cards.name: Hermes Courier
cards.ability: Draw 1 additional card when this ship is in orbit
cards.flavor: Information travels at the speed of light. My ship travels faster. —Courier Pilot Nash

art.style: Minimalist sci-fi like Moebius (Jean Giraud)
art.description: A sleek, compact messenger ship with emphasis on speed. The design features aerodynamic lines, oversized engines, and minimal armaments. The ship has a distinctive single-pilot cockpit with enhanced visibility and data relay equipment. The color scheme uses clean whites with accent colors marking its purpose as a communications vessel.

cards.name: Guardian-class Defense Platform
cards.ability: Protects adjacent ships from first attack each turn
cards.flavor: An unyielding sentinel stands watch where human vigilance alone would fail. —Station Commander Park

art.style: Detailed isometric technical illustration like Stephen Biesty
art.description: An orbital defense station with multiple weapon emplacements and shield generators. The station has a central command module surrounded by defensive arrays in a star pattern. The design includes visible internal compartments showing crew operations and power distribution systems. The station is positioned in low orbit over a partially visible planet surface.

cards.name: Orbital Command
cards.ability: Grants +1 to all Terran attempt rolls
cards.flavor: From up here, we see the whole battlefield. Coordination wins wars. —Admiral Kerner, Orbital Command

art.style: Cinematic hyperrealism like Peter Elson
art.description: A large hexagonal command center with extensive communication arrays and docking facilities. The station features a central glass-domed command bridge with spectacular views of the planet below. The exterior shows multiple landing bays, habitat rings, and defensive systems. The human element is emphasized with visible crew working throughout the structure.

cards.name: Research Station Alpha
cards.ability: Generates 2 Science points per turn
cards.flavor: The universe doesn't give up its secrets easily, but we're patient. —Dr. Singh, Research Director

art.style: Clean retrofuturism like Robert McCall
art.description: A scientific outpost with multiple observatory domes and experimental apparatus. The station has a wheel design for artificial gravity with spoke-like connectors to a central zero-G laboratory. The exterior features solar arrays, telescopes, and specialized research equipment. The background shows stars and cosmic phenomena being studied by the station's instruments.

cards.name: Orbital Shipyard
cards.ability: Reduce cost of ship deployment by 1 Energy (minimum 1)
cards.flavor: Every hull that leaves these docks carries humanity's future among the stars. —Master Builder Tanaka

art.style: Industrial concept art like Ralph McQuarrie
art.description: A massive construction facility with ships in various stages of assembly. The shipyard features enormous robotic arms, manufacturing modules, and raw material processing units. A partially completed capital ship is visible in the main construction bay. The facility bustles with activity as worker drones and maintenance craft swarm around the structure.

cards.name: Survey Team Alpha
cards.ability: Can locate hidden resources and artifacts
cards.flavor: Every step on alien soil writes a new chapter of human history. —Dr. Chen, Xenobiology Division

art.style: Painted illustration like Frank Frazetta
art.description: A group of armored explorers examining alien ruins on a windswept plain. The team carries advanced scanning equipment and defensive weapons as they investigate a partially buried alien structure. Their environment suits feature Terran insignia and specialized scientific tools. The lighting captures the harsh alien sun casting long shadows as the team documents their findings.

cards.name: Vanguard Elite
cards.ability: Can attack twice per turn but cannot counter-attack
cards.flavor: Strike first. Strike hard. Let the enemy know humanity's wrath. —Sergeant Major Kane, Vanguard Division

art.style: Military sci-fi concept art like Wayne Barlowe
art.description: Heavily armored shock troops with advanced weaponry storming a defensive position. The soldiers wear powered exoskeletons with integrated weapon systems and tactical displays. Their armor features adaptive camouflage partially engaged and distinctive insignia denoting elite status. The composition shows them in dynamic combat poses amid alien terrain.

cards.name: Combat Engineers
cards.ability: Can repair one damaged structure per turn
cards.flavor: We build under fire and repair under siege. It's what we do. —Chief Engineer Morrison

art.style: Detailed technical concept art like Craig Mullins
art.description: Specialized troops with equipment designed for battlefield construction and repair. The engineers operate advanced fabrication tools and portable shield generators. Their armor is more utilitarian than combat troops with multiple tool attachments and diagnostic equipment. The scene shows them repairing damaged defensive structures while under partial cover.

cards.name: Science Corps
cards.ability: Doubles Science generation of adjacent Research structures
cards.flavor: In the field, theory becomes reality. That's where the real breakthroughs happen. —Professor Yamada

art.style: Bright sci-fi illustration like Angus McKie
art.description: Civilian specialists in lightweight environmental suits collecting samples from alien flora. The scientists use holographic interfaces and automated sample collection drones. Their equipment emphasizes data collection rather than combat capabilities with extensive sensor packages. The background shows a vibrant alien ecosystem with unusual plant formations and atmospheric conditions.

cards.name: Mobile Research Lab
cards.ability: Generates 1 Science point per turn, can be upgraded with Science equipment
cards.flavor: Science doesn't wait for safety. We bring the lab to the discovery. —Dr. Martinez, Field Research

art.style: Cutaway technical illustration like Hans Jenssen
art.description: A modular wheeled laboratory with deployable research equipment. The structure features a transparent dome section housing scientific equipment and specimen analysis stations. The design shows both exterior details and a cutaway revealing the interior layout and scientists at work. The lab is positioned in an alien landscape with equipment deployed around its perimeter.

cards.name: Advanced Research Complex
cards.ability: Generates 3 Science points per turn, advances science-based win conditions
cards.flavor: Here we unlock the secrets that will shape humanity's next thousand years. —Director Volkov, Advanced Research

art.style: Architectural concept art like Syd Mead
art.description: A sprawling scientific installation with multiple specialized research domes. The complex combines function and form with elegant structural elements supporting various research apparatus. The facility includes habitat sections, power generation, and defense systems integrated into a cohesive design. Atmospheric effects show how the structure interacts with the alien environment.

cards.name: Planetary Shield Generator
cards.ability: Can activate up to 3 shield segments, each requiring 1 turn and 2 Energy
cards.winCondition: When all 3 segments are active with no enemy units on the surface, achieve System Control victory
cards.flavor: An impenetrable shield for an irreplaceable world. This is how we claim the stars. —Chief Technician Petrov

art.style: Cinematic sci-fi scene like Doug Chiang
art.description: A massive energy projection facility with three enormous emitter towers. The generator shows energy visibly coalescing at the tower peaks before expanding outward. The design incorporates cooling systems, power distribution networks, and control facilities. The partial atmospheric shield is visible as a translucent dome extending from the generators into the sky above.

cards.name: Terraforming Control Node
cards.ability: Modifies planetary environment each turn, providing cumulative bonuses to Terran units
cards.flavor: We don't just visit worlds—we make them home. —Terraforming Specialist Nguyen

art.style: Environmental concept art like Stephan Martiniere
art.description: A control center surrounded by visible environmental transformation effects. The structure features monitor arrays showing planetwide data and atmospheric composition readings. The immediate vicinity shows accelerated plant growth and atmospheric processors at work. Energy fields extend from the central spire, visibly altering the surrounding landscape in concentric circles.

cards.name: Temporal Distortion Array
cards.ability: Can delay opponent actions by spending Energy equal to the action's cost
cards.flavor: Time is just another battlefield advantage when you know how to manipulate it. —Dr. Ramirez, Temporal Research

art.style: Abstract technical art like Peter Elson
art.description: A bizarre geometric structure with components that appear to exist in multiple states simultaneously. The array features crystalline elements suspended in electromagnetic fields with energy coursing between nodes. The surrounding space shows visual distortion effects with light bending around the structure. The design deliberately challenges conventional physics with impossible angles and temporal echoes.

cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.ability: All Terran structures gain +1 Defense
cards.flavor: A web of protection, each node reinforcing the whole. Together, unbreakable. —Grid Commander Hassan

art.style: Hard sci-fi technical illustration like Ron Miller
art.description: A network of interconnected orbital platforms generating a protective energy mesh. The grid consists of multiple smaller units working in concert to project energy barriers between them. The design emphasizes efficient energy distribution with power conduits visible between nodes. The protective barrier is shown intercepting incoming projectiles or energy weapons.

cards.name: Quantum Observatory
cards.ability: Reveals one card from opponent's hand each turn
cards.flavor: We see more than stars from up here. We see intentions, possibilities, futures. —Observer First Class Kim

art.style: Retro-space age illustration like Chesley Bonestell
art.description: An orbital telescope array with multiple detection systems studying spatial anomalies. The observatory features distinctive dish arrays, quantum entanglement detectors, and computing clusters. The structure captures the wonder of cosmic exploration with dramatic positioning near a stellar phenomenon. The design includes human observation decks providing scale to the massive instruments.

cards.name: Orbital Factory
cards.ability: Produces 2 Energy per turn that must be spent on equipment or upgrades
cards.flavor: The asteroid belt provides, and we transform raw rock into the tools of civilization. —Factory Director Wei

art.style: Industrial sci-fi like John Harris
art.description: An automated manufacturing facility processing asteroid materials in orbit. The factory features massive refineries, assembly lines, and material storage areas. Raw resources enter one end while completed components emerge from the other. The design emphasizes industrial processes with conveyor systems, robotic assemblers, and quality control stations visible throughout the structure.

cards.name: Quantum Sensor
cards.ability: Adds +2 to Scan attempts and allows scanning through interference
cards.equipTarget: Any ship or structure with Scan capability
cards.flavor: It doesn't just see through walls—it sees through reality itself. —Tech Specialist Anderson

art.style: Technical close-up illustration like Katsuhiro Otomo
art.description: A sophisticated scanning device with multiple lenses and quantum field detectors. The device shows internal components through translucent casing with holographic readouts hovering above its surface. The design incorporates both advanced technology and ergonomic considerations for field use. Energy patterns visibly flow through the device's circuitry as it processes data.

cards.name: Shield Generator
cards.ability: Target gains +2 Defense and can extend shields to one adjacent unit
cards.flavor: The best offense is not getting hit in the first place. —Engineering Manual, Defensive Systems

art.style: Detailed cross-section technical art like Hans Jenssen
art.description: A compact energy projection system with visible power core and emitter array. The generator shows both exterior casing and internal components in a technical cutaway view. The device projects a visible energy field that contours to the shape of what it's protecting. Power distribution systems and cooling mechanisms are clearly illustrated in the technical rendering.

cards.name: Quantum Warheads
cards.ability: Equipped ship gains +2 Attack and ignores 1 point of Defense
cards.flavor: When conventional weapons fail, we have options that bend the rules of physics. —Weapons Officer Strauss

art.style: Military technical illustration like Ian McQue
art.description: Advanced weapon systems with reality-warping destructive capabilities. The warheads feature distinctive warning markings and security systems to prevent unauthorized use. The design shows both the delivery mechanism and the exotic materials contained within. The scale of the weapons is emphasized by including human figures for reference near the storage racks.

cards.name: Advanced AI Core
cards.ability: Equipped unit or structure can perform one additional action per turn
cards.flavor: It thinks faster than any human, but it still needs us to tell it what to care about. —AI Specialist Kowalski

art.style: Cyberpunk digital art like Josan Gonzalez
art.description: A neural network processor with holographic interface showing decision trees. The core features cooling systems necessary for quantum computing operations and security protocols. The design shows data visualizations emerging from the processing unit with human operators monitoring its functions. Light patterns suggest sentient activity within the crystalline structure of the processor.

cards.name: Orbital Bombardment
cards.ability: Deal 3 damage to target ground unit
cards.effect: Deal 3 damage to target ground unit
cards.flavor: Precision from the heavens. The enemy never sees it coming. —Gunnery Chief Barnes

art.style: Dramatic action scene like Simon Stålenhag
art.description: A devastating energy beam from orbit striking a planetary target with precision. The beam originates from a capital ship partially visible at the top of the frame. The impact creates a shockwave visible from the orbital perspective while remaining precisely targeted. The surrounding environment shows the scale of the attack through atmospheric effects and ground damage patterns.

cards.name: Dropship Deployment
cards.effect: Move crew from one ship to reinforce a Surface Unit (+1 to all actions this turn)
cards.flavor: Reinforcements inbound! Hold the line! —Platoon Commander Jackson

art.style: Military action scene like James Gurney
art.description: Troops rapidly descending from a dropship under combat conditions. The ship hovers just above ground level with deployment ramps extended and defensive systems active. Soldiers sprint from the ship into defensive positions while under fire from unseen enemies. The scene captures the controlled chaos of battlefield deployment with smoke, atmospheric effects, and urgent movement.

cards.name: EMP Pulse
cards.effect: Disable target enemy structure or ship for one turn
cards.flavor: Their systems go dark, and for one critical moment, we own the battlefield. —Tactical Officer Brennan

art.style: Technical effect visualization like Moebius
art.description: An expanding electromagnetic wave disabling electronic systems in its path. The pulse originates from a compact device with energy rippling outward in concentric blue rings. Enemy systems visibly short-circuit and power down as the wave passes over them. The illustration uses cross-section elements to show how the pulse affects different technologies.

cards.name: Reinforcements
cards.effect: Draw 2 cards and immediately deploy one unit at -1 cost
cards.flavor: The Consensus never abandons its own. Reinforcements are always coming. —Admiral Kerner

art.style: Space opera action scene like Chris Foss
art.description: Multiple ships emerging from a gate formation in a dramatic arrival moment. The reinforcement fleet arrives in perfect formation with energy still dissipating from interstellar travel. The design emphasizes the coordinated nature of the Terran military response with ships of various classes arriving simultaneously. The background shows the tactical situation they're arriving to address.

cards.name: Final Protocol
cards.effect: Activate ultimate ability of target structure without meeting normal requirements
cards.flavor: When all else fails, we have contingencies. Desperate, powerful contingencies. —Emergency Protocol Manual

art.style: Dramatic moment like John Harris
art.description: A technician activating an emergency system with visible gravity to the moment. The scene shows the final safeguard being removed and the activation sequence initiating. The design emphasizes the significance of the action with warning symbols, multiple confirmation systems, and the determined expression of the operator. Energy begins cascading through previously dormant systems as the protocol activates.

cards.name: Emergency Evacuation
cards.effect: Return target surface unit to orbit, preventing its destruction
cards.flavor: We leave no one behind. That's not a slogan—it's a promise. —Evac Coordinator Mills

art.style: Tense action scene like Philippe Druillet
art.description: Personnel being rapidly extracted from a deteriorating situation. The evacuation shows transport vessels loading under duress with priority materials and personnel. The scene captures the organized urgency of Terran evacuation protocols amid environmental hazards. The composition directs focus to both the evacuees and the danger they're escaping.

cards.name: Orbital Bombardment
cards.ability: Deal 3 damage to target ground unit
cards.effect: Deal 3 damage to target ground unit
cards.flavor: Orbital superiority means we choose when and where to apply overwhelming force. —Fleet Coordinator Saito

art.style: Epic scale destruction like Karel Thole
art.description: Multiple orbital platforms coordinating a wide-area attack on a planetary surface. The bombardment consists of dozens of energy beams converging on a target area from different orbital positions. The attack creates visible atmospheric disturbances as the beams cut through cloud layers. The scale of the operation is emphasized by showing both the orbital platforms and the extensive surface effects.

cards.name: Quantum Entanglement
cards.effect: Link two Terran cards, allowing them to share abilities and bonuses
cards.flavor: Distance becomes meaningless when quantum physics is on your side. —Dr. Hoffmann, Quantum Applications

art.style: Abstract scientific visualization like Donato Giancola
art.description: Two separate Terran systems becoming synchronized through quantum effects. The entanglement is visualized as energy patterns that mirror each other despite physical separation. The illustration shows both the scientific principle and its tactical application in the field. Subtle color shifts indicate the transfer of properties between the linked systems.

cards.name: Sacrifice Play
cards.effect: Transfer all power and abilities to target structure or unit
cards.flavor: Sometimes the only way forward is to give everything you have. —Captain Liu's final transmission

art.style: Emotional narrative moment like Julie Bell
art.description: A Terran officer making a fateful decision to divert all power to a critical system. The composition shows both the officer's resolute expression and the consequences of their decision as systems begin shutting down. The design emphasizes the human element of sacrifice amid advanced technology. Energy visibly transfers from the sacrificed system to the receiving system in a last-ditch effort.

cards.name: Scientific Breakthrough
cards.effect: Double Science generation for one turn
cards.flavor: Eureka! Everything we thought we knew just became obsolete. —Dr. Patel, Theoretical Physics

art.style: Inspirational scientific moment like Bob Eggleton
art.description: Researchers experiencing a moment of discovery with visible excitement. The laboratory shows holographic data coalescing into a new understanding with researchers pointing at key elements. The design captures the intellectual triumph with appropriate scientific imagery and equipment. The moment of breakthrough is emphasized by lighting that focuses on the central discovery.

cards.name: Tactical Maneuvers
cards.effect: Reposition up to 3 Terran units or ships
cards.flavor: Flexibility is survival. Adapt, reposition, and strike where they least expect. —Tactical Manual, Chapter 3

art.style: Strategic visualization like John Schoenherr
art.description: A holographic command table showing unit repositioning during an operation. The display shows both friendly and enemy positions with movement paths and tactical options. The design includes command staff analyzing the situation and implementing changes. The visualization uses color coding and symbols consistent with military tactical displays.

cards.name: Diplomatic Initiative
cards.effect: Prevent all attacks for one round, draw 1 card
cards.flavor: Not every problem requires bullets. Sometimes words are the most powerful weapon. —Ambassador Okoro

art.style: Formal diplomatic scene like Frank R. Paul
art.description: Terran representatives engaging with alien counterparts in a negotiation chamber. The diplomatic meeting takes place in a neutral space with appropriate ceremonial elements from both cultures. The design emphasizes the tension and potential of diplomatic exchange through body language and environmental details. Security personnel remain visible but unobtrusive in the background.

cards.name: Quantum Encryption Matrix
cards.ability: Once per turn, prevent an opponent's attempt
cards.flavor: We barely understand it, but we've learned to use it. That's progress. —Dr. Zhang, Artifact Research

art.style: Abstract alien technology like Richard M. Powers
art.description: An incomprehensible device of clearly non-human origin with impossible geometry. The artifact appears to phase between multiple states with information patterns visible within its structure. The design deliberately defies human engineering principles while suggesting immense computational capability. Researchers visible in the scene provide scale and show attempts to interface with the technology.

cards.name: Chronometric Stabilizer
cards.acquisition: Found in ancient ruins, requires Science ship scan
cards.ability: Enhance temporal effects, allowing reroll of one die per turn
cards.flavor: It predates our civilization by millennia, yet it grants us glimpses of futures yet to come. —Archaeologist Dubois

art.style: Ancient-meets-futuristic like Jim Burns
art.description: A device that appears simultaneously ancient and beyond current technology. The stabilizer features clockwork-like mechanisms that operate in unusual dimensions with visible temporal effects surrounding it. The design includes both the artifact and the Terran containment systems attempting to harness its capabilities. Temporal distortion is visualized as rippling effects in the local environment.

cards.name: Planetary Consciousness Core
cards.acquisition: Located in neutral territory, requires control of planetary sector
cards.ability: Special win condition enabler when combined with other technologies
cards.flavor: It's alive. Not biological, but alive. And it's been waiting for someone to find it. —Dr. Ivanova, First Contact Team

art.style: Mind-bending alien artifact like Paul Lehr
art.description: A massive crystalline structure buried within planetary crust that pulses with sentient energy. The core features organic-seeming patterns despite its crystalline nature with energy pathways resembling neural networks. The design shows both the artifact and the surrounding excavation revealing its true scale. Human figures near the artifact appear diminished, emphasizing its monumental importance.

cards.name: Orbital Dropship
cards.ability: LAND: Tap and sacrifice to deploy a Marine Squad to the planet surface.
cards.flavor: Thirty seconds to dirt. Check your gear and say your prayers. —Drop Commander Williams

art.style: Military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A heavily armored troop transport designed for orbital insertion. The craft features ablative heat shielding, retro-thrusters, and a reinforced passenger bay. Deployment ramps extend from the underside as the craft descends through atmosphere.

cards.name: Orbital Dropship
cards.ability: LAND: Tap and sacrifice to deploy a Marine Squad to the planet surface.
cards.flavor: Thirty seconds to dirt. Check your gear and say your prayers. —Drop Commander Williams

art.style: Military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A heavily armored troop transport designed for orbital insertion. The craft features ablative heat shielding, retro-thrusters, and a reinforced passenger bay. Deployment ramps extend from the underside as the craft descends through atmosphere.

cards.name: Orbital Dropship
cards.ability: LAND: Tap and sacrifice to deploy a Marine Squad to the planet surface.
cards.flavor: Thirty seconds to dirt. Check your gear and say your prayers. —Drop Commander Williams

art.style: Military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A heavily armored troop transport designed for orbital insertion. The craft features ablative heat shielding, retro-thrusters, and a reinforced passenger bay. Deployment ramps extend from the underside as the craft descends through atmosphere.

cards.name: Orbital Dropship
cards.ability: LAND: Tap and sacrifice to deploy a Marine Squad to the planet surface.
cards.flavor: Thirty seconds to dirt. Check your gear and say your prayers. —Drop Commander Williams

art.style: Military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A heavily armored troop transport designed for orbital insertion. The craft features ablative heat shielding, retro-thrusters, and a reinforced passenger bay. Deployment ramps extend from the underside as the craft descends through atmosphere.

cards.name: Orbital Dropship
cards.ability: LAND: Tap and sacrifice to deploy a Marine Squad to the planet surface.
cards.flavor: Thirty seconds to dirt. Check your gear and say your prayers. —Drop Commander Williams

art.style: Military sci-fi like Chris Foss
art.description: A heavily armored troop transport designed for orbital insertion. The craft features ablative heat shielding, retro-thrusters, and a reinforced passenger bay. Deployment ramps extend from the underside as the craft descends through atmosphere.

cards.name: Survey Team Beta
cards.ability: Can locate hidden resources and artifacts. Grants +1 Research when surveying.
cards.flavor: The universe is vast, but we'll map every corner of it. —Survey Lead Thompson

art.style: Painted illustration like Frank Frazetta
art.description: A second survey team examining crystalline formations on an alien landscape. Their equipment includes advanced ground-penetrating sensors and holographic mapping devices.

cards.name: Survey Team Gamma
cards.ability: Can locate hidden resources and artifacts. Grants +1 Research when surveying.
cards.flavor: These ruins hold secrets worth dying for. Good thing we're not planning to die. —Team Leader Foster

art.style: Painted illustration like Frank Frazetta
art.description: An elite survey team investigating ancient ruins. They carry specialized equipment for artifact recovery and analysis.

cards.name: Survey Team Delta
cards.ability: Can locate hidden resources and artifacts. Grants +1 Research when surveying. Enhanced defensive capabilities.
cards.flavor: Hostile environment? We're Survey Team Delta. Hostile is our specialty. —Field Commander Reeves

art.style: Painted illustration like Frank Frazetta
art.description: A heavily-equipped survey team with additional defensive gear. They specialize in surveying hostile territories.
